title: Apple Student Discount: How to save on new iPads, MacBooks and more
description:
![Apple
logo](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Apple has unveiled its new[2018
iPad](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/ipad-2018-release-date-3423309) this
week, a 9.7-inch device the company is hoping to conquer the classroom with as
well as continuing its broader tablet appeal.**

It’s available to consumers from £319 in the UK. That gets you the 32GB, Wi-
Fi-only model. The 128GB model with Wi-Fi and cellular connectivity costs a
much heftier £539. In the US, meanwhile, it’s available to consumers from
$329.

**Related:[New iPad
(2018)](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/ipad-2018-release-date-3423309)**

However, if you’re a student, you can shave a little off those figures. Apple
has a special ‘Education Pricing’ store, which lets you buy its products at
slightly discounted prices.

“To help you get everything you need, Apple offers education pricing for
university students, students accepted into university, parents buying for
university students, and teachers and staff at all levels,” the company says.

All you need to do is prove you’re a current student or member of staff.

In the UK, the Education Pricing version of the Apple Store is hidden behind a
[verification
barrier](https://www.apple.com/uk/shop/browse/home/education_routing/find_your_institution/access),
which you can only get past by entering your UNiDAYS account details. But
based on prior experience, we can confirm that it indeed is the real deal and
will get you the best Apple deals around – provided you’re eligible.

Just don’t like, OK? You’ll get caught out and this isn’t dodging a forced
Windows upgrade, after all…

We’ve asked Apple for UK education pricing figures, and will update this
article when we hear back.

What we also know is that discounts apply across Apple’s range, but different
products are discounted at different rates.

In the US, there’s no barrier and the price differences are therefore much
clearer. If you’re a student or member of staff, you can get the new 2018 iPad
for $309 rather than $329. That’s a handy little reduction well worth taking
advantage of.

We’d expect similar discounts on Apple products here in Blighty, though note
that said new Apple tablet already enjoys a £20 price cut (compared to the
previous 2017 model) when buying in the UK. So you may already be in luck, as
it were.

The new tablet is available in silver, space grey and gold colour schemes, and
will begin shipping to buyers this week.

If you’re eligible, be sure to head over to the [Apple Store for
Education](https://www.apple.com/uk/shop/browse/home/education_routing/find_your_institution/access)
page to check out the discounts.
